{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ewing's sarcoma is characterized by a specific chromosomal translocation. According to the documents, the most common translocation in Ewing's sarcoma is t(11;22). This translocation is present in about 90% of Ewing sarcoma cases and results in the fusion of the EWSR1 gene with the FLI1 gene.", "answer_choice": "B. t(11,22)"}
